pageContext.description:
Copper alloy ring, probably dating to the Bronze Age or Iron Age. This example is similar to rings found in Suffolk (SF-7BD5C1), Norfolk (NMS-688046), North Lincolnshire (NLM-2CB634) and Shropshire (HESH-4B9AC5).


The object is 5mm thick, 18mm in exterior diameter, 8.5mm in interior diameter and weighs 5.32g.


The use of this object is difficult to interpret. It may have had a decorative function in harness or personal dress. It shows no particular signs of wear, but is chipped with a small chunk missing on the outside edge. The surface of the object has a dark brown patina with pitting, and orange and green corrosion where the surface has been broken.
